history.definition: Firearm purchase/possession is prohibited for some people with alcoholism
State dealer license required for handgun sales
Record keeping and retention required for all sellers and all dealers for handgun sales
Record keeping and retention required for licensed dealers for handgun sales
Reporting of sales records to the state required for all sellers and all dealers for handgun sales
Reporting of sales records to the state required for licensed dealers for handgun sales
State is not required to purge sales records for at least 60 days after purchase
At least one store security precaution required
Waiting period is required on all handgun purchases from dealers
Permit required to carry concealed weapons
"May issue" state
Applicants are required to make a heightened showing to obtain a concealed carry permit
No stand your ground law
No law provides blanket immunity to gun manufacturers or prohibits state or local lawsuits against gun manufacturers

Firearm purchase/possession is prohibited for some people with alcoholism
State dealer license required for handgun sales
Permit required to carry concealed weapons
Concealed carry permit process requires a background check
Concealed carry permit renewal requires a new background check
State law automatically prohibits misdemeanor crime of domestic violence (MCDV) offenders from possessing firearms
State law automatically prohibits domestic violence-related restraining order (DVRO) subjects from possessing firearms
